meanings.definition: The imitation or reproduction of the style or ideas of a predecessor.
meanings.sent1: Her epigonism in painting closely mirrored the techniques of the famous artist she admired.
meanings.sent2: The art world often sees epigonism as a form of flattery towards established artists.
meanings.sent3: In a humorous twist, his epigonism in music led him to accidentally create a new genre.
meanings.sent4: Her epigonism in fashion was like wearing a costume of her favorite designer.
meanings.sent5: The young writer's epigonism was so blatant that critics called her work a mere copycat attempt.

meanings.definition: A person who imitates or follows the style or ideas of a predecessor.
meanings.sent1: He was known in literary circles as an epigonism, always emulating the writing of classic authors.
meanings.sent2: The fashion industry is filled with epigonisms trying to replicate the success of famous designers.
meanings.sent3: The epigonism at the party was so convincing that some mistook him for the original artist.
meanings.sent4: She felt like an epigonism of her mother, following in her footsteps in every aspect.
meanings.sent5: The young musician's epigonism was evident in every note he played, echoing his idol's style.
